summary: Completed e2e testing of Teams 24 Careers Job Board after Next.js migration. Backend APIs (17/17 tests passed), frontend UI working correctly. Fixed MongoDB _id leak in POST responses. Found minor rating display issue.

ui_bugs.issue: Rating displays 'NaN' because API returns 'score' field but component expects 'rating' field
ui_bugs.selector: CandidateRating component in candidate detail modal

action_items: Fix rating data transformation in AdminDashboard - API returns 'score' (0-10) but component expects 'rating' (0-5). Need to transform ratings array to match expected structure.
critical_code_review_comments: MongoDB _id was leaking in POST responses for /api/jobs and /api/applications - FIXED by excluding _id from response
Rating data structure mismatch: API seed data uses {score, maxScore} but CandidateRating expects {rating}. The AdminDashboard transformation doesn't handle this properly.

success_rate.frontend: 95% (all major flows working, minor rating display issue)

seed_data_creation: Created test applications during API testing (TEST_John Tester, TEST_QA Engineer job)
context_for_next_testing_agent: Next.js migration complete. All API routes working (/api/health, /api/jobs, /api/applications). MongoDB connection stable. Admin dashboard, Kanban board, Job Management all functional. Search and filters working. Only issue is rating display showing NaN due to data structure mismatch between API (score/maxScore) and component (rating).
